Fourth Street, Roebling Point, Covington, KY 41011 At Molly Malone’s Irish Pub, we thrive on creating a lively atmosphere where you can dive into authentic Irish dishes and explore our fantastic selection of drinks. With live music every week and dedicated spaces for private events, we’re the ideal spot to gather with friends and celebrate special occasions. It's Almost our Annual 1/2 Way to St. Patrick's Day Party in. Friday, September 12th through Sunday, September 14th Find our more here! Check Out Our New Food Menu! View Here Welcome to Molly's! The Best Irish Restaurant & Pub in Phoenixville Where people come from all over for authentic Irish cuisine, top shelf cocktails & even better company! JOIN OUR TEAM! Now accepting applications for Hosts, Hostesses, Servers and Security! APPLY NOW! Patio & Balcony Seating Available for a Scenic View View Menu Book Our Private Party & Event Space! Learn More Molly Maguires Irish Restaurant and Pub Established in 2007 Molly Maguire’s Irish Restaurant & Pub, centrally located at the corner of Bridge & Main in the heart of downtown Phoenixville, is one of the finest authentic Irish Pubs in the entire Philadelphia area. Our Phoenixville restaurant menu offers outstanding Irish cuisine, mouth-watering desserts, a full bar with a fantastic craft beer selection, daily happy hour specials, and live entertainment & events every week! But don’t just take our word for it, see for yourself what people are saying about the best Irish Pub and restaurant in Phoenixville. Molly’s also offers numerous private dining rooms and a variety of group dining options to help make your special event a memorable one. Whether it’s a birthday party, rehearsal dinner or company event, Molly’s can easily accommodate any special occasion! View Menu & Order Online Reserve a Table Live Music Every Friday & Saturday Catering & Private Parties View Menu & Order Online Reserve a Table Live Music Every Friday & Saturday Catering & Private Parties CIGARS UNDER THE STARS OCTOBER 7, 7 PM -10 PM Join us for an evening of rich flavors and smooth indulgence, where fine whiskey meets premium cigars in the warm ambiance of Molly Maguire’s. Where: 3rd floor Roof Top at Molly’s *Limited tickets available for purchase below. Tickets are $70 each. The ticket includes 2 Premium cigars paired with bourbon and Tapas items. Please drink responsibly. Get your tickets here! HAPPY HOUR Monday – Friday 5:00pm to 7:00pm Drink Specials $5 Wines $5 Well Mixers $5 Draft Beers (16 oz.) Food Specials $7.50 Appetizers Choose from Colcannon Potato Balls, Cheesesteak Egg Rolls, Buffalo Chicken Egg Rolls, Pretzel Bites, or Irish Curry Fries BRUNCH IT! Saturdays & Sundays 11:00am to 2:00pm Full Breakfast Menu Omelets, Pancakes, Bounty Platters, Irish Breakfast, Celtic Breakfast Boxty, Breakfast Sandwiches, French Toast, Breakfast Burgers, Rasher’s, Bangers, Home Fries & more available! Brunch Drink Specials $6 Orange Crushes $5 Bloody Marys $5 Mimosas Gift Cards Give the gift of good food! Purchase Gift Card Gift Cards Give the gift of good food! Purchase Gift Card Follow Us on Instagram to Stay Up to Date on What’s Happening at Molly’s! Join Our Team! Molly Maguire’s is hiring! We are currently looking for experienced and skilled servers and runners to join our team at Molly’s! Part-time and full-time positions available. Experience is required & training will be provided. Learn more about employment at Molly’s and apply now at the link below! Learn More & Apply Now Take a Virtual Tour of Molly Maguires! Irish Pub & Restaurant Glyfada Athens – Molly Malones's Athens – Irish Pub & Restaurant in Glyfada Athens. Molly Malone's Irish Pub Restaurant provides you the best experience in drinks and food. HOME  | MENU  | NEWS-EVENTS  | Irish Pub & Restaurant... A new Taste Experience... Enjoy unique Drinks... Authentic GUINNESS... The best Irish Pub in Athens... A must Irish Pub... About us. Molly Malones was the first authentic Irish Pub to be established in Athens . It was opened in Glyfada Athens in December 2003 and quickly became one of the most popular venues in the South Eastern suburb of Athens. Come and enjoy our unique blend of good food and drink in friendly surroundings served by cheerful and welcoming staff.! “All major sporting events are shown on out large-screen televisions and if there is a particular football match or other event that you would like to see please ask one of the staff if it is available and we will do our best to find it for you.” Legend Irish music…Hit play! https://mollymalones.gr/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Saw-Doctors-Green-and-Red-of-Mayo-lyrics.mp3 . Menu. Take a brief look in our Menu (food & drinks). Menu Preview Photo gallery. . News - Events. Learn first our news and events we share with you, for you.! News - Events . Contact with us. Get in touch with Molly Mallone’s stuff. tel.: (210) 8944 247 | email.: info@mollymalones.gr Giannitsopoulou 8, Glyfada, Athens Meet James Joyce.. Best Irish Pub & Restaurant in Monastiraki, Athens..!! James Joyce © Copyright 2003 -2018 Molly Malones's Irish Pub & Restaurant at Glyfada  |  Giannitsopoulou 8, Glyfada, Athens - 210 8944 247

Take Survey Subscribe Today Living | Food & Drink | Brews & Spirits | Drink Cascadia Drink Cascadia Beloved Bellingham bar reborn, refined on Cornwall Avenue Uisce Irish Pub officially (re)opened for business in a new, improved location June 9, 2024 10:00 p.m. Bartender Cameron Frazier prepares a drink on Thursday, June 6. He worked as a bartender at the old Uisce Irish Pub and returned to work at the new location. ( Hailey Hoffman /Cascadia Daily News) By Brandon Fralic CDN Contributor Uisce Irish Pub is now open in downtown Bellingham. Gaelic for “water,” Uisce (pronounced “Ish-Kah”) celebrated its rebirth as a local watering hole on Thursday, June 6. Long-time Bellinghamsters will remember the original Uisce, which opened on St. Patrick’s Day in 2006. Bellingham’s beloved Irish pub was an institution, so the community was shocked to see it close in August 2022. Thankfully, owner Molly McGarry and her team promised to return — and nearly two years later, Uisce is back in business at a new location, 1409 Cornwall Ave. “It’s true what they say: One door closes and another one opens,” McGarry said. “In my opinion, this place is gonna work a lot better for us.” The new Uisce is smaller, which lends itself to a more intimate and refined pub experience. McGarry and her team brought the best qualities of the old Uisce to the new space, including what she calls the “magic” from years of gathering at the original pub. Dozens visited Uisce Irish Pub for its reopening at the new Cornwall Avenue location. ( Hailey Hoffman /Cascadia Daily News) “It was magic, and it was special. It was like the community hub to many different people over the years,” she said. “And so, I’m happy when people come in and they’re like, ‘Oh, it feels good’ — they sit in the same spot at the bar.” Built by Lummi Island woodworker Tom Lutz in 2006, the legendary Uisce bar looks right at home in the new space. Aaron Kuhaulua (AK Crafted Woods & Design) took the bar apart, removed 7 feet, and rebuilt it to fit inside the pub’s Cornwall Avenue location. Sitting beside me at the bar, McGarry explained one of its finer details: “The big ‘U’ circles are where we used to have our beer towers,” she said. “I hope that people can appreciate the detail that we took so long to create.” McGarry and her team rebuilt the new space from the ground up, only retaining one wall over a full year of construction. Little details are everywhere — from the Celtic knot along the floor to the orange dart board backdrop, which serves as an ode to the original Uisce. A bartender pours a drink. ( Hailey Hoffman /Cascadia Daily News) “All the artwork is the same. All of these are family portraits that we had in my old spot,” McGarry said, pointing out photos illuminated by hand-picked light fixtures. Large windows let natural light into the building, providing an “architectural view” of Uisce’s neighboring Federal Building. Constructed in Italian Renaissance Revival style in 1913, the historic building still serves as downtown Bellingham’s post office. Beer-wise, you can expect the classic Uisce lineup including Guinness Stout, Harp Lager, and Smithwick’s Red Ale along with a local beer, cider and gluten-free beer option. A couple next to me at the bar said Uisce is the only place they’ve found Harp on draft in Bellingham. It’s a subtle reminder that there’s no other place in town like Uisce, so we “cheers” to the new space with a round of golden Harps. When it comes to cocktails, Uisce is known for its Irish coffee and Old Fashioned — both made from family recipes. The cocktail menu also includes gin-based drinks like the negroni, Bee’s Knees, and French 75. Alternatively, spring for The Irishman — a pint of Guinness paired with an Irish whiskey. (Fun fact: Uisce boasts the largest selection of Scotch and Irish whiskey in Bellingham.) One of the most exciting additions to Uisce’s new space is food; specifically, pizza. Launching with a limited menu, Uisce now offers four personal-size pizzas: cheese; pepperoni; jalapeno and pineapple; and pesto, sausage and pepper. The dough is made fresh using a French baking technique called poolish, a type of pre-ferment (similar to a sourdough starter) that lends flavor and a toothsome, chewy texture to the finished crust. And, of course, they still offer their fan-favorite pretzels. Uisce is open every day of the year, even Christmas. “It’s actually one of our busiest days,” McGarry said. “We consider ourselves to be an industry bar. So, we get a lot of restaurant clientele when they get off work — we get a huge late-night following.” Uisce plans to host future events including trivia, whiskey tastings, live music and a belated St. Patrick’s Day Party. For now, McGarry — who is continuously interrupted during our conversation by delighted customers seeing the new bar for the first time — simply wants to celebrate the magic of Uisce with her community. “It’s exciting to see people’s excitement when they come in,” she said. “Some of these people … were some of my first customers back in 2006. And I haven’t seen them in years — friends that I consider family.” Uisce Irish Pub is open daily from 4 p.m. to 2 a.m. at 1409 Cornwall Ave. Info: uisceirishpub.com . From left, Margaret Driscoll, Kera Newman and Howie Meltzer play music together in the pub. Uisce Irish Pub has long been a hub for musicians to gather and play together while sipping beer and cocktails. ( Hailey Hoffman /Cascadia Daily News) Brandon Fralic's Drink Cascadia column appears monthly. Reach him at drinkcascadia@gmail.com .
